summary: This bill, S. 550, addresses land disputes involving the Miami Tribe of Oklahoma in Illinois. It grants the U.S. Court of Federal Claims jurisdiction to hear specific land claims related to the 1805 Treaty of Grouseland, waiving statute of limitations. This jurisdiction expires one year after the bill's enactment if a claim isn't filed.  The bill also extinguishes all other land claims by the Miami Tribe in Illinois, seeking a final settlement of these issues.
